fields.description:
I want to use following codes to customize left navigation menus. Full codes can be find in customized left navigation.txt.

cloak.toggle.type = custom
cloak.toggle.close = TestToggleInTheme^arrow_open.PNG
cloak.toggle.open = TestToggleInTheme^arrow_close.PNG

The problem is the customized left navigation cannot work for the whole space.
If I put the same codes to content page the navigation bar can work as expected. See TestToggleInTheme.PNG.
If the content page doesn't include above codes the navigation bar fails. See TestToggleInTheme2.PNG.  

How to fix this? Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: composition-setup,cloak,toggle-cloak cannot work in customized Theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21916].
  {panel}

It would be very useful to be able create a link to the current version of a page that didn't track updates as they are made in future.

It is already possible to create a link to a historical page, but the latest version always tracks the current version. To simulate the functionality I want I am forced to make a trivial change to the page and then grab a link to the now historical version.

For example. A page has 3 versions

3. (CURRENT)
2.
1.

It is possible to get a link to versions 1+2 but not 3 because if I make a change like so

4. (CURRENT)
3.
2.
1.

The link to 3 previously now points to 4. 

Obviously most of the time this feature is essential, but sometimes I would like to be able to grab a link that didn't get updated (specifically I have a use-case for release notes, where i want to link to a snapshot of documentation)
fields.summary: ability to link to absolute version of current version

fields.description:
When copying and pasting rich content - for example links or simple text styling - from one web source to another, the RTE does a decent job of parsing the HTML and converting it to the appropriate wiki markup. However, certain valid HTML is not correctly parsed, and upon attempting to save the page, a stack trace is thrown. The problematic code appears to be inline CSS where an RGB color value is presented, followed by an {{!important}}. This particular combo of code, while totally valid HTML/CSS, reliably produces an error, the full paghe stack trace of which can be viewed on the attached {{full_page_stack_trace.pdf}}.

*Steps to Repro:*
# Download the attached {{code_copy_example.html}}, and load the page in your browser.
# Highlight the large red text and copy to your clipboard.
# Paste this into the Rich Text tab of an Edit page in Confluence.
# Notice that the large red text is pasted normally and is displayed as large red text in the RTE.
# Click the Save button.

*Expected:*
The page is saved and displayed in a way that closely matches what was shown in the RTE, aka there is larger than default red text.

*Actual:*
A stack trace is thrown.
fields.summary: RTE fails to parse valid HTML, throws stack trace error

at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)

h5. Root cause
The following columns have foreign key constraints against them but no indexes on the columns themselves.
{code}
CONFANCESTORS.ANCESTORID                     
EXTERNAL_MEMBERS.EXTENTITYID                    
LOCAL_MEMBERS.USERID                         
OS_USER_GROUP.GROUP_ID                       
TRUSTEDAPPRESTRICTION.TRUSTEDAPPID
{code}
For example, the CONTENT table has a foreign key constraint on its ANCESTORID column against CONFANCESTORS.ANCESTORID but there is no index on that ANCESTORID column in the table CONFANCESTORS. This can lead to performance problems, and has been shown for some customers to lead to a deadlock problem in Oracle 11G, which [is more deadlock sensitive than 10G|http://markjbobak.wordpress.com/2008/06/09/11g-is-more-deadlock-sensitive-than-10g/].

Here's an explanation of the situation. If two people save a (different) page and these pages have been saved as draft before, Confluence will be doing two database operations for each user:
# Deleting the draft
# Updating the original page
As there is no index on column ANCESTORID in table CONFANCESTORS (but the table is referenced via a foreign key constraint), Oracle has to lock the whole table CONFANCESTORS to perform the delete operation in the table CONTENT. This may lead to deadlock situation if the other user want to update and delete at the same time.

h5. Workaround

  # Execute http://www.ixora.com.au/scripts/sql/missing_fk_indexes.sql to obtain columns which are used as foreign keys but don't have indexes on them.
  # Create indexes for all tables/columns returned by it in confluence schema.

That should eliminate table-level locks.
fields.summary: Deadlocks in Oracle 11G due to missing indexes

fields.description:
{panel}
h2. Workaround Available

Customers experiencing this issue are now able to apply a patch to their local Confluence instances in order to resolve this problem. Additionally, an official fix for the bug will be shipped in Confluence 3.3.2 and Confluence 3.4.

This patch may be applied to all versions of Confluence after (and including) Confluence 3.2.1. Earlier versions of Confluence may not work with this patch.

h3. Patch Instructions (for Confluence Standalone)

# Download the [rendered-content.vm|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/40404/rendered-content.vm] file attached to this issue.
# Copy the file into your Confluence install directory, under {{<confluence_install>/confluence/pages}}.
# Restart Confluence.

{panel}

When previewing this page on CAC, the preview pane doesn't expand to fit the content:

- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Confluence+Objects+Accessible+From+Velocity
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/editpage.action?pageId=201744

Originally reported by a customer on the old issue, CONF-17470.

-Bug fixers note: please make sure we have a Selenium test for this issue so it doesn't regress again.- (This issue resulted from a change in Firefox 3.6.7 and later, so this note is no longer relevant.)
fields.summary: CLONE - Editor preview doesn't expand to show complete content

fields.description:
When attempting to load a bogus space name that's very long, Confluence runs a query against the "spaces" table to see if it exists.  For DB2 queries, this results in a database error:

{code}
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: Could not execute query; SQL []; DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-302, SQLSTATE=22001, SQLERRMC=null, DRIVER=4.3.111; nested exception is com.ibm.db2.jcc.a.zn: DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-302, SQLSTATE=22001, SQLERRMC=null, DRIVER=4.3.111
    at org.springframework.jdbc.support.SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator.java:110)

caused by: com.ibm.db2.jcc.a.zn: DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-302, SQLSTATE=22001, SQLERRMC=null, DRIVER=4.3.111
    at com.ibm.db2.jcc.a.dd.a(dd.java:668)
{code}

Here's the query:

{code}
2011-02-24 22:00:02,029 DEBUG [http-8090-3] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log select space0_.SPACEID as SPACEID, space0_.SPACENAME as SPACENAME, space0_.SPACEKEY as SPACEKEY, space0_.SPACEDESCID as SPACEDES4_, space0_.HOMEPAGE as HOMEPAGE, space0_.CREATOR as CREATOR, space0_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION7_, space0_.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI8_, space0_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD9_, space0_.SPACETYPE as SPACETYPE, space0_.SPACEGROUPID as SPACEGR11_ from SPACES space0_ where (lower(space0_.SPACEKEY)=? )
{code}

Steps to reproduce:

# Open a URL like:  http:<server>
# Check the error message displayed
# Check the application logs for database errors

fields.description:
When exporting a page to PDF which uses the gallery macro to display images with captions, the resulting PDF does not keep the captions aligned underneath the associated images.

*Steps to Repro:*
# create a page
# attach a few images and add comments to these images
# on the page add the gallery macro: {{{gallery}}}
# save the page and observe that your attached images are aligned in a grid with the comments aligned properly underneath as captions
# on the Tools menu select Export to PDF
# view your shiny new PDF

*Expected:*
The PDF maintains a similar layout as the source page, so the captions are still aligned below their respective images.

*Actual:*
The images look the same, but the captions are misaligned and don't match up with the images.

fields.description:
The Table of contents in the PDF is generated based on pagetitles, not based on the headings in the document. This means that the document structure does not necessarily match the table of contents.

For example, lets say the document structure is as follows, each separate wiki page is marked with a star
{noformat}
|- h1. Introduction*
|- h1. Basic use*
  |- h2. First command*
  |- h2. Second command*
|- h1. Advanced use*
  |- h2. Extra command
|- h1. Final words*
{noformat}

Note how the {{Advanced use}} wiki page contains the subheading Extra command, which is not a separate wikipage.

The table of contents will be rendered completely omitting the h2. Extra command.

{noformat}
|- h1. Introduction*
|- h1. Basic use*
  |- h2. First command*
  |- h2. Second command*
|- h1. Advanced use*
|- h1. Final words*
{noformat}

What I would expect is that the table of contents for the pdf would be generated based on the hX, since those describe the document's structure. Also it makes the table of contents completely useless for long wiki pages.

In our case, we are using CSS rules to add numbers to the headings (which wasn't too easy to figure out how to do). However since the toc isn't generated from the document strucuture, while the CSS rule for numbering is, they get out of sync when some headings aren't in the TOC.
fields.summary: TOC in pdf export only uses pagetitles

fields.description:
When using the left navigation theme in Confluence 3.3.1, create a space and set up a Task list Macro with a task inside.

I was able to reproduce this issue by accessing Confluence with a user that has only view access towards the affected space and try to Browse Space Operations or Browse Space buttons. The menu doesn't open.

But there are 2 ways to make them work:
1) Give them user create page permission in the affected space and menus will work.
2) Remove the contents from the dynamic tasklist and menus will work.

By verifying with Firebug, I noticed that these lines get's grayed and so the menus doesn't open as expected:

<div id="browsenav" class="subnav" style="display: none;"> should become <div id="browsenav" class="subnav" style="display: block;"> but it doesn't.

Same as this: <div id="pagenav" class="subnav" style="display: none;"> should become <div id="pagenav" class="subnav" style="display: block;">.

org.springframework.jdbc.BadSqlGrammarException: Hibernate operation: Could not execute query; bad SQL grammar []; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000

Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21858].
  {panel}

Background:

Studio has the suckiest raciest flimsiest ugliest mechanism for ensuring that JIRA, Confluence, FishEye and Bamboo all have trusted apps relationships with each other.  If you don't believe me, ask Charles, and watch him shiver.  A combination of wanting to fix this, and that this mechanism is not compatible with UAL, has led the Studio team to actually attempt to fix it.  Our strategy is to make JIRA, Confluence, FishEye and Bamboo all use the same trusted apps keys, this means that nothing needs to be done to sync them all together, as long as each app trusts its own certificates, they will all be in sync.

So, there are three pieces of information that must be the same across all three apps, the private key, the public key, and the application ID.  The application ID must be the same because each app will add their own applicaiton ID to each signed request, and then that application ID will have to be the ID at the remote end because it uses that ID to look up the applications it trusts.  This is where Confluence fails.  com.atlassian.confluence.security.trust.DefaultTrustedApplicationsManager has a hard coded mechanism for generating a trusted application id from the SID, it can't be overridden.

Some ideas for implementing this may be:

* Check bandana for an application ID before using the SID based one
* Store trusted apps id in ApplicationConfiguration
* Add a flag to the KEYSTORE table to indicate which key is the current application key
* Allow a system property to override the application ID
* Define some sort of mechanism for plugging into the thing that generates the application ID
fields.summary: Allow a custom current application ID to be used for trusted apps

fields.description:
We have a new instance, with data restored from a Confluence 2.10 instance.  We integrated Crowd authenticated based on AD user groups.
We have an AD group called crowd-confluence-administrators (so named to differentiate it in Confluence from the restored legacy confluence-administrators group), which I can see in Crowd and in Confluence.  In confluence this is the only group in Global permissions with System Admin and Confluence Admin rights.
We have logging into Confluence working for our users with their AD password,  so I know we have at least some part of the Crowd authentication right.
When those users in the crowd-confluence-administrators group click on Browse, Confluence Admin, they are prompted for a password again.  I see this as an extra security measure, and I'm not logging that as a problem.
What happens at this stage however is that their AD password is not accepted. They must enter their old Confluence user password to get admin access. When their AD password changes, the password they use to get admin rights does not - it's just not looking to Crowd/AD for the password at that point.  Why not?  Is this a bug or a config issue?
fields.summary: AD/Crowd authenticated administrators using Confluence-controlled password (not the AD one)

fields.description:
Have seen:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Preparing+for+Confluence+4.0
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.0+Editor+FAQ#Confluence4.0EditorFAQ-WhyisAtlassianintroducinganeweditor%3F

And participated in discussion about the removal of the full-page wiki markup editor here:
http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=51646

I think I understand the reasons why the wiki markup editor for the full page's content is being removed.

I also understand that Atlassian is striving to make the new editor as faster or faster than using wiki markup.

I further understand that Atlassian is planning on providing a way to insert wiki markup via the new editor, but just not a way to edit the whole page in wiki markup.

However, I'd still like to see a way to edit all of a page's content in wiki markup, rather than just a way to insert wiki markup into the page. This could be done through an optional plugin, but it would be nice if it were provided by Atlassian and perhaps included by default in the Confluence release.

Even if this feature isn't included in the first version of 4.0, I think it would be a good (re)addition in a future release. In addition, it would be nice to enable this in other Atlassian products (not just as a Confluence plugin), since I prefer wiki markup in Jira as well.
fields.summary: Please provide a way to edit all of a page's content at once in wiki-markup

fields.description:
When importing a doc file and split it in many level. An image which is frequently used by many pages is unable to display. This is due to the reason that the image is stored at the parent page and the child page is only calling the image by "\!imagename.png\!" rather than "\!parent^imangename.png\!". 

h3. Step to reproduce
# Import the following TC17_UG_indexes1.doc
# Split by heading: Level 4 Headings
#* !doc_import_1.png!
# Import it

\\
After the import, some pages will display a similar error as below:
!doc_import_2.png!

This only happens when you are splitting with multiple level of headings.

h3. Workaround
*Workaround 1*
You may need to edit the image link in wiki markup on each missing links

*Workaround 2*
# Install Global Search and Replace Plugin
# Find the image at the parent page
# Replace this wiki markup "\!imagename.png\!" with "\!parent^imagename.png\!" to all pages under the parent page

fields.description:
In {{confluence.cfg.xml}} there is an option called {{admin.ui.allow.daily.backup.custom.location}} to allow / disallow daily backup to be saved to a custom location.

If enabled, the admin will be able to tell Confluence to make daily backup to a different location from the daily backup admin panel.

The problem starts when this option is set to false - Confluence will still retain the custom directory location and continue to save the daily backup there.

Confluence should not do that. If this option is set to false, Confluence should save daily backup to its default location in {{<confluence home>/backups}}
fields.summary: admin.ui.allow.daily.backup.custom.location still allows Confluence to create backup to custom location even if it's set to false

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21837].
  {panel}

Currently, when CamelCase Linking is enabled, you must use the nl or nolink syntax to unlink a word that is camel-cased.  However, this only works for unlinking an individual string.  If CamelCase Linking creates links within strings, unlinking should be permitted within strings as well.

For example:
C:\CamelCase_Test\Whatever

C:\{nl:CamelCase}_Test\Whatever

Trying to unlink CamelCase does not work like this.  It will only work if there is whitespace surrounding the tag:

C:\ {nl:CamelCase} _Test\Whatever

But then, if someone wanted to copy and paste the link, it would be invalid.
fields.summary: Allow Unlinking Within a Single String

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21836].
  {panel}

The PermissionManager's transaction proxy is set up like this:

{code:xml}
<!-- from securityContext.xml -->
    <bean id="permissionManager" class="org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionProxyFactoryBean" plugin:available="true">
        <property name="transactionManager">
            <ref bean="transactionManager"/>
        </property>
        <property name="target">
            <ref local="permissionManagerTarget"/>
        </property>
        <property name="transactionAttributes">
            <props>
                <prop key="get*">PROPAGATION_REQUIRED,readOnly</prop>
                <prop key="is*">PROPAGATION_REQUIRED,readOnly</prop>
                <prop key="*">PROPAGATION_REQUIRED</prop>
            </props>
        </property>
        <property name="proxyInterfaces">
            <value>com.atlassian.confluence.security.PermissionManager</value>
        </property>
        <property name="postInterceptors">
            <list>
                <ref bean="profilingInterceptor"/>
            </list>
        </property>
    </bean>
{code}

But some of its readonly methods have "has" prefixes.  This leads to unnecessary read-write transactions and thus extra commits.

Eg 
{noformat}
	com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyConnection.commit(NewProxyConnection.java:803)
	net.sf.hibernate.transaction.JDBCTransaction.commit(JDBCTransaction.java:63)
	org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.doCommit(HibernateTransactionManager.java:510)
	org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.processCommit(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:662)
	org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.commit(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:632)
	org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionAspectSupport.commitTransactionAfterReturning(TransactionAspectSupport.java:314)
	org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:116)
	org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	$Proxy22.hasCreatePermission(Unknown Source)
	com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.web.conditions.user.UserCanUpdateUserStatusCondition.shouldDisplay(UserCanUpdateUserStatusCondition.java:17)
	com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.web.conditions.BaseConfluenceCondition.shouldDisplay(BaseConfluenceCondition.java:30)
{noformat}
fields.summary: PermissionManager should only require readonly transaction for has* methods

has some property to disallow comments ?? )
fields.summary: Can't enter comment on http://tekwiki.tek.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=58885439

fields.description: See screenshot. You can drag pages below the list of pages. They stick around at the bottom and it looks pretty weird. This bug has existed since at least 3.3.1
fields.summary: Reorder pages lets you drop anywhere, which causes graphical corruption

fields.description:
A shadow user is a user that has been duplicated - they exist in both local and external user management.

This is a potential cause for confusion to Confluence administrators and plenty of support requests.

Richard suggested that we should find a way to search these users and purge them from Confluence.
fields.summary: Find a way of finding and purging all shadowed users from Confluence

fields.description:
When there is a duplicate user scenario in both local user management and LDAP, where the local user has a can use permission and the LDAP one does not, the duplicate user will be counted towards the license.

The expected behaviour is that it should not. If we follow [this doc|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=180294162] it says that users with a can use permission (or belong to a group that has that) will be counted towards the license - but from the admin perspective, the LDAP user management should prevail over the duplicated local user.

Discrepancies observed:
- In viewuser.action panel, Confluence reports the user as "This user isn't in any groups."
- But if we go to domembersofgroupsearch.action?membersOfGroupTerm=groupnameWithACanUsePermission panel, we will see the local user there.
fields.summary: Duplicate LDAP user gets counted towards the license even when they do not have a can use permission

fields.description:
When I edit and already existing confluence page and strike out some text and save it, it saves without saving the strike out. 
Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to an existing confluence page.
2. Edit and strike out some text
3. save it
4. Notice that the text is not striked out.
fields.summary: On an already existing confluence page, if I try to strike out text and save, it doesnt save the strike out
Anchor doesn't work properly when sending the page via e-mail using page mail plugin.

fields.description:
There is currently a bug with XWork Actions which use the '!method' syntax to execute 'doMethod()'. The problem is caused by the DefaultActionProxyFactory, which creates a new ActionConfig based on the existing, non-command version of the ActionConfig. The problem is that when the original is a PluginAwareActionConfig, the factory does not take that into account, and thus when the '!method' Action is created, the ConfluencePluginObjectFactory will not correctly inject it with <component> or Spring beans from the plugin.

The fix is for Confluence to provide a ConfluenceActionProxyFactory which checks if the ActionConfig being cloned is a PluginAwareActionConfig, and if so, copies it as a PluginAwareActionConfig so that it gets instantiated correctly.
fields.summary: Plugin-defined Actions using 'name!method.action' calls injected with plugin-defined components.

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)

This is happening for Attachments and UserStatus, and may happen for several other datatypes as well. It only happens where the LDAP user is missing a full name value in confluence (i.e. the PersonalInformation object referenced by the Attachment has a null fullName value, or the UserStatus has a null fullName value, etc).

This exception should never be thrown, as null values need to be handled in each of the extractors.

h2. Workaround

    1) Disable the UserStatusExtractor in the User Status Plugin in Confluence Admin > Plugins.
    2) Disable the EmbeddedSubCalendarsExtractor in Team Calendars (if installed)
    3) Reindex.
    4) Watch for any other stack traces. If there are any, contact support.

Note: make a note of which Extractors you will have to disable in case you need to enable them again.

The above changes should result in:

    * The object that any disabled Extractor pertains to will not be searchable
    * The rest of the content will be indexed correctly and will be searchable

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Confluence \{toc} macro. All versions from 2.9 to 3.4.8 are affected.

XSS vulnerabilities potentially allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a Confluence page. You can read more about XSS attacks at various places on the web, including these: 
* cgisecurity.com: http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml
* The Web Application Security Consortium: http://projects.webappsec.org/Cross-Site+Scripting

This issue is reported in our security advisory on this page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/MgCzDQ

The page also includes detailed patch instructions.
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in Table of Contents (toc) macro

fields.description:
If you insert a blogposts macro in a page with the [content=titles|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Blog+Posts+Macro#BlogPostsMacro-3.Displayonlythetitlesoftheblogpost] parameter execution of the macro still renders each of the blog posts being displayed even though we only need their titles.

There is a performance saving to be made here. But there is also a stability improvement to be had. Should any of the pages picked up by the macro have a rendering problem then the page with the macro on it will also error (unnecessarily).

I doubt this is a common occurrence we were just running into it a lot in Confluence 4.0 development since we used to have so much shit broken while we monkeyed around on the internals. (Of course it all works like a dream now :-)
fields.summary: A blogposts macro with the content=titles parameter still renders each of the blogs found

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21806].
  {panel}

In conjunction with https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-56838:

There isn't a way to force refresh a page or in other words invalidate a page cache (via query string, pageId=xxxx&cache=0, etc., etc.)?

The following page describes a way to inject explicit cache in a page and ways to refresh the caches. However this works for only {cache} macro.
https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/CACHE/Confluence+Cache+Plugin

A way to refresh a page cache would really be helpful (being a developer I guess a query string URL parameter to allow this would be a nice feature!)

fields.description:
a) Have a class using logging e.g. ca.gc.ic.pssb.strm.util.VelocityLoggerHelper
b) a standard Lob object is used to log
private static final Log LOGGER = LogFactory.getLog(VelocityLoggerHelper.class);
c) have some code inside doing some logging at the debug level using this class
d) the class is part of our theme and the logging happens on basically any page, many .vmd files call it
e) start the server
f) go on the different pages triggering some logging, nothing happens. This is normal, the root level is higher
g) go to the Logging and Profiling screen and add the entry ca.gc.ic.pssb.strm.util.VelocityLoggerHelper select ALL then click on ADD ENTRY
h) go on the different pages triggering some logging, nothing happens and this time this is not normal (you could try to SAVE the list of entries, no difference)
i) go to the Logging and Profiling screen and click on PRODUCTION, the list of entries is refreshed
j) go on the different pages triggering some logging, nothing happens. This is normal, the root level is higher
k) go to the Logging and Profiling screen and add the entry ca.gc.ic.pssb.strm.util.VelocityLoggerHelper select ALL then click on ADD ENTRY
l) go on the different pages triggering some logging and you get some logging.

Basically, it seems that you need to click once on PRODUCTION or DIAGNOSTICS.
Before all the changes that you do adding entries just do nothing.
It seems that you stay with the DEFAULT setting which is obviously the same as PRODUCTION.
The values initially displayed at the bottom are the PRODUCTION ones.

The good behavior should be that as soon as you add an entry, remove one, change one then the settings at the bottom because you enter in the CUSTOMISED mode.

The existing behavior is counter intuitive. You add or change the entries and nothing happens.
fields.summary: Adding a new entry to the existing levels in the Logging and Profiling screen just after the boot does nothing, you need to click first on production or diagnostic
